summary:
Trap music is a type of hip-hop that started in Atlanta, Georgia, in the late 1990s. It's named after "trap houses," where drugs are sold. Trap music has simple, rhythmic beats with complex drum patterns and lyrics about urban life, drugs, and violence.

Artists like T.I., Jeezy, and Gucci Mane helped make trap popular. In the 2010s, it became one of the most popular music genres in the U.S., with many artists like Drake and Ariana Grande using trap beats in their songs. Trap's influence can also be heard in other genres like reggaet√≥n and K-pop.
title: Trap music
